intro: Vandellia strigosa, commonly known as the slender vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
